meanings.definition: A person who uses high-sounding language to impress others.
meanings.sent1: The bombaster in the meeting kept using big words to sound important.
meanings.sent2: The politician's bombaster was evident in his speeches filled with grandiose phrases.
meanings.sent3: The bombaster at the party tried to impress everyone with his fancy vocabulary.
meanings.sent4: Her bombaster was like a colorful balloon, full of air but lacking substance.
meanings.sent5: The bombaster of the professor made the lecture confusing rather than enlightening.

meanings.definition: Pompous or pretentious speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: His bombaster annoyed everyone with its exaggerated grandeur.
meanings.sent2: The bombaster in her writing made it hard to understand the main point.
meanings.sent3: The bombaster of the CEO's speech made the employees roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The bombaster of the advertisement promised more than it could deliver.
meanings.sent5: The bombaster of the author's novel made it difficult to take seriously.
